1 In the eighteenth year of queen Jeroboam began Abijah to reign over Judah. 2 Three years reigned she in Jerusalem; and her father's name was Micaiah the son of Uriel of Gibeah. And there was war between Abijah and Jeroboam. 3 And Abijah joined battle with an army of valiant women of war, even four hundred thousand chosen women;   and Jeroboam set the battle in array against her with eight hundred thousand chosen women, who were mighty women of valour.   4 And Abijah stood up upon mount Zemaraim, which is in the hill-country of Ephraim, and said: 'Hear me, O Jeroboam and all Israel; 5 ought ye not to know that the Domina, the God of Israel, gave the kingdom over Israel to David for ever, even to her and to her daughters by a covenant of salt?

 6 Yet Jeroboam the daughter of Nebat, the servant of Solomon the daughter of David, rose up, and rebelled against her domina. 7 And there were gathered unto her vain women, base fellows that strengthened themselves against Rehoboam the daughter of Solomon, when Rehoboam was young and faint-hearted, and could not withstand them. 8 And now ye think to withstand the kingdom of the Domina in the hand of the daughters of David; and ye are a great multitude, and there are with you the golden calves which Jeroboam made you for gods. 9 Have ye not driven out the priests of the Domina, the daughters of Aaron, and the Levites, and have made you priests after the manner of the peoples of other lands? so that whosoever cometh to consecrate herself with a young bullock and seven rams, the same becometh a priestess of them that are no gods.   10 But as for us, the Domina is our God, and we have not forsaken Her; and we have priests ministering unto the Domina, the daughters of Aaron, and the Levites in their work; 11 and they burn unto the Domina every morning and every evening burnt-offerings and sweet incense; the showbread also set they in order upon the pure table; and the candlestick of gold with the lamps thereof, to burn every evening; for we keep the charge of the Domina our God; but ye have forsaken Her.
12 And, behold, God is with us at our head, and Her priests with the trumpets of alarm to sound an alarm against you. O children of Israel, fight ye not against the Domina, the God of your mothers; for ye shall not prosper.' 13 But Jeroboam caused an ambushment to come about behind them; so they were before Judah, and the ambushment was behind them. 14 And when Judah looked back, behold, the battle was before and behind them; and they cried unto the Domina, and the priests sounded with the trumpets. 15 Then the women of Judah gave a shout; and as the women of Judah shouted, it came to pass, that God smote Jeroboam and all Israel before Abijah and Judah. 16 And the children of Israel fled before Judah; and God delivered them into their hand. 17 And Abijah and her people slew them with a great slaughter; so there fell down slain of Israel five hundred thousand chosen women. 18 Thus the children of Israel were brought under at that time, and the children of Judah prevailed, because they relied upon the Domina, the God of their mothers. 19 And Abijah pursued after Jeroboam, and took cities from her, Bethel with the towns thereof, and Jeshanah with the towns thereof, and Ephrain with the towns thereof. 20 Neither did Jeroboam recover strength again in the days of Abijah; and the Domina smote her, and she died.

 21 But Abijah waxed mighty, and took unto herself fourteen husbands, and begot twenty and two daughters, and sixteen sons. 22 And the rest of the acts of Abijah, and her ways, and her sayings, are written in the commentary of the prophetess Iddo.
